verse.roman:
tebhyo viśuddhaṁ vijñānaṁ
bhagavān vyatarad vibhuḥ
yenaivātmany ado viśvam
ātmānaṁ viśva-gaṁ viduḥ

synonyms: tebhyaḥ—upon them; viśuddham—perfectly pure; vijñānam—divine knowledge; bhagavān—the Supreme Lord; vyatarat—bestowed; vibhuḥ—the Almighty; yena—by which; eva—indeed; ātmani—within Himself, the Supreme Lord; adaḥ—this; viśvam—universe; ātmānam—Himself; viśva-gam—pervading the universe; viduḥ—they could perceive.
translation: The all-powerful Lord Balarāma bestowed upon the sages pure spiritual knowledge, by which they could see the whole universe within Him and also see Him pervading everything.
